item.title: No loading stripes worn away, 11th September
item.description:
Reported before and no action yet. Outside number 7 & 9 Letchworth Drive the No Loading stripes on kerb have come off. Should be replaced by sub-contractor free of charge as they've de-bonded- never applied properly, shoddy job. Hence vans do not see they should not stop and continue to block us in drive during the day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Letchworth Drive, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on road, 11th September
item.description:
Edge Hill is being used as a commercial (unlicensed?) scrap yard/rubbish tip. Various vehicles (that rarely move) are piled high with rubbish. A bicycle selling business is being run, with bikes stored/abandonded on the highway - chained to railings. The rubbish storage has been ongoing, the cycle business is a more recent addition. The businesses are an eyesore, and detrimental to the environment

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edge Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unlit, untethered trailer, 11th September
item.description:
Continued parking of unlit, untethered trailer, which overhangs parking bay. Owner seems to be using road to store commercial trailer, which is neither lit not tethered to a vehicle and too big for the bay
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Letchworth Drive, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This allay is in king hall road up to up clock house and its doing today please, 11th September
item.description:
I would like to raise a concern regarding the waste management in the alleyway adjacent to 79 King Hall Road. The refuse bin in this location is frequently overflowing, resulting in widespread litter and posing significant health and hygiene risks. This area appears to be consistently overlooked during routine collections. I urge the relevant management team to investigate this matter and implement a sustainable solution to ensure regular maintenance and cleanliness. Reported via desktop in the Public Litter Bin category anonymously at 18:21, Tuesday Sent to Bromley Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 8143629.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Rubbish, household items urination, 11th September
item.description:
I have reported this several times. Yesterday, it was partly resolved but left very unclean. I reported again and this was marked not the council’s responsibility. It is public area and I pay council tax. Please resolve fully or explain why you refuse to
